messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a world with 16 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 2, 3, 4, and 7. Room 2 is connected to rooms 1, 3, 4, and 16. Room 3 is connected to rooms 1, 2, 4 and 5. Room 4 is also connected to rooms 1, 2, 3, and 14. Room 5 is connected to rooms 6, 7, 8, and 3. Room 6 is connected to rooms 5, 7, 8, and 12. Room 7 is connected to rooms 1, 8, 6, and 5. Room 8 is also connected to rooms 5, 6, 7, and 10. Room 9 is connected to rooms 10, 11,12, and 15. Room 10 is connected to rooms 9, 11, 8, and 12. Room 11 is connected to rooms 13, 9, 12, and 10. Room 12 is also connected to rooms 9, 10, 11, and 6. Room 13 is connected to rooms 14, 15, 16, and 11. Room 14 is connected to rooms 4, 13, 15, 16. Room 15 is connected to rooms 13, 14, 16, and 9. Room 16 is also connected to rooms 13, 14, 15, and 2. From room 1 what is the shortest path to room 13? Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

Do not include the word "and" between the room numbers.

You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

As a young child I am always eager to know new things. As I grew up I wanted to learn about my own world, I wanted to know what was beyond our planet. I used to look up at the sky and wonder what the universe looked like. I even remember when I was a child I thought that the sky was the ceiling and that's why I couldn't see beyond it. I used to think that the sky was a glass that we can see through and that there was something else beyond the glass.

But as I grew up, I found out that the sky was not the ceiling. It was the limit, the boundary of our world. I also found out that the universe is much bigger than we think. The universe is an endless space, with no boundaries. There is no end to it, it is just a vast space with no end.

In order to answer this question, we need to understand
